result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antonio D. Antunez Sandoval

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(9:22 AM case called.) Defendant Antonio D. Antunez Sandoval not in court. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Antonio D. Antunez Sandoval. Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Interpreter Monica Marin present.
Attorney Rivard advises the defendant was picked up by Homeland Security and deported. Court excuses the interpreter.
State has an offer to resolve all cases and requests a little time to allow Attorney Rivard to get in contact with the defendant.
Attorney Rivard advises spoke with the defendant last week on the phone and has a number that should work.
Arraignment scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Conditions: 
No contact with V.M. or their residence. 
(Covers 20CM515, 21CF1048, 22CF802) 
($5,000 cash previously posted)

(1:33 PM cases 20CM515, 21CF1048, 22CF802 called.) Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Antonio D. Antunez Sandoval in court, in custody. Attorney Francis Xavier Rivard in court for Antonio D. Antunez Sandoval.
Interpreter Christina Green sworn and interprets.
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
State requests to begin with case 21CF1048.
21CF1048:
State calls Officer Jared Rico of the Altoona Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
State requests the Court find a transactional relation between Counts 1 and 2. Attorney Rivard has no objection. Court finds the counts are transactionally related.
Attorney Rivard conducts cross-examination of Officer Rico. Witness excused.
Attorney Rivard makes no argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Rivard to schedule and Arraignment with Branch 5 Judicial Assistant.
22CF802:
State calls Officer Kiana Marshall of the Altoona Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Rivard conducts cross-examination of Officer Marshall. 
State conducts re-direct of Officer Marshall. Witness excused.
Attorney Rivard makes no argument.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Rivard to schedule cases 21CF1048, 22CF802 for Arraignment and Hearing in 20CM515 which will ride along with the felony cases.
(End: 2:02 PM)
Preliminary hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Cases called at 1:37 PM: 20CM515, 21CF1048, 22CF802. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Antonio D. Antunez Sandoval in court, in custody without counsel.  Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. Spanish Interpreter Christina Green appeared via video. She is sworn and interprets.
Defendant indicates that he is no longer employed and that he applied for a County Appointed Attorney on Saturday. 
Preliminary Hearings adjourned to 8/2/22 at 1:30 PM.
Clerk to inquire with Clerk of Courts to determine if an Application for County Appointed Attorney has been filed.
Adjourned at 1:46 PM.

Conditions:
No contact with V.M. or their residence.
(Covers 20CM515, 21CF1048, 22CF802)
($5,000 cash previously posted)

(Cases called at 3:20 PM - 20CM515, 21CF1048, 22CF802)
Defendant Antonio Antunez Sandoval appears in custody with Attorney Karl Schmidt.  Attorney Trenton Piltz appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Spanish Interpreter, Christina Green, appears via Zoom videoconference, is sworn and interprets.  Warrants executed in 20CM515 and 21CF1048.  Court outlines the charges and probable cause of the new complaint (22CF802).  Defense waives further reading of the Complaint.  State requests $10,000 cash bond (to include $5,000 cash already posted).  Defense requests the Defendant be allowed to post an additional $1,000 cash to the $5,000 cash the Defendant has already posted.  Court orders a $10,000 cash bond (Defendant will need to post an additional $5,000 to be released) to cover all files.  Defense indicates that the Defendant does not qualify for a Public Defender and has been referred to the Clerk of Court Office to apply for a Court-Appointed Attorney. 
Preliminary Hearing: July 26, 2022 at 1:30 PM (20CM515 to ride-along) (adjourned 3:35 PM)
Routed to Defendant in jail along with petition for Court-Appointed Attorney (form in Spanish)
